Text:
.@ChrisMurphyCT and I advocated for an additional $50 million to support #Ukraine in combatting cyber-attacks. 

Now is the time to pass bipartisan legislation to support Ukraine and provide this critical funding to our ally in the face of this unwarranted aggression by Russia.

This week we celebrate National FFA Week! With 25,577 members in 324 chapters throughout our state,  @OhioFFA provides our students with essential leadership skills and helps develop the next generation of ag leaders and innovators. Learn more here: https://t.co/GTGHULv0qJ

US Intelligence has indicated that Russia is prepared to escalate its illegal occupation of Ukraine in the coming days, as Kyiv is currently experiencing cyber-attacks. The administration should enact export controls and further sanctions now to deter these malign actions.
My statement on Russia’s invasion of Ukraine: https://t.co/kgss3fGhN7 https://t.co/Br7DCKhOo6

Encouraged that #Germany has recognized the national security threat posed by NordStream 2.  Russia's illegal occupation of the Donbas is a clear violation of Ukrainian territory and must be met with sanctions and diplomatic condemnation. This decision by Germany is a good start.

Putin's decision to recognize the Ukrainian separatist republics is a violation of the Budapest Memorandum  and a pretext for further military action against Ukraine. The administration must immediately enact all available sanctions on Russia. https://t.co/whceA1djEC

As tensions continue to rise in Eastern Europe, we can’t lose sight of the potential for a massive humanitarian crisis. 

Tens of thousands of lives  - including countless civilians - will likely be lost if Russia launches an unprovoked invasion.

Take it from fmr economics adviser to President Obama @SteveRattner: surging inflation is the result of too much government stimulus in the economy. Time for Dems to instead work with Republicans on common-sense economic policies. https://t.co/XqLVzmPqW8
The failure of this admin to control our southern border has resulted in record levels of deadly fentanyl coming into the US, leading to more American lives being lost and families devastated.

The surge in illicit narcotics coming over our border also continues to rise, with seizures of fentanyl increasing 57% over the last month. These illicit narcotics, including deadly fentanyl, are taking a record number of lives in communities in #Ohio & across our country.

Once again, the monthly @CBP operational stats show that the ongoing migrant crisis at our southern border continues. This January was the worst January in more than 20 years with a reported nearly 154K total encounters at the border last month. https://t.co/VJKF9LRgP9
Democrat’s reckless policies have helped plunge our nation into the worst inflation crisis we’ve seen in decades. From the gas pump to the grocery store, middle-class families are feeling the pinch.

This week a bipartisan majority in the US Senate sent a clear and resounding message: the United States stands with Ukraine and the Ukrainian people as they face the prospects of a Russian invasion.  https://t.co/bcmzcMa3ZL

This is a 96% increase from the Jan 2021 encounters of more than 78K & more than 4x from Jan 2020's 36,585 total encounters. This crisis is a direct result of the Biden admin’s decision to dismantle the previous admin’s border policies w no consideration of the consequences.

I’m alarmed the January @CBP operational stats show that our nation saw the worst Jan in more than 20 years as the unlawful migration crisis continues with a reported nearly 154,000 total encounters at the border in January. https://t.co/VJKF9LRgP9

Harriet Tubman dedicated her life to helping others escape the bondage of slavery. She was a trailblazer who paved the way for countless civil & women's rights leaders. 

This wk the Senate honored her life & legacy by approving Harriet Tubman commemorative coins.

Approving the sale of top of the line Abrams tanks to our ally Poland sends the right message to Russia. We will stand with our allies against unwarranted aggression.  These tanks are made at #JSMC Lima by the greatest workforce in the world. 
https://t.co/t1FpJTmW94

The Senate just unanimously approved my resolution with @SenatorShaheen denouncing the buildup of Russian troops at Ukraine’s border and reaffirming our bipartisan commitment to hold Russia accountable if they invade our ally Ukraine.

Thanks to the bipartisan infrastructure law, the GLRI is receiving $1B to strengthen our Great Lakes preservation & restoration efforts by accelerating the clean up of Areas of Concern & addressing the threats of algal blooms, invasive species, pollution & habitat degradation.
We need to address that fragmentation to create a single source of accountability and enhance our bio-defenses & be better prepared for any future bio-threats.https://t.co/wBL7h2x4wb

During a #HSGAC hearing today, expert witnesses agreed w/ me that there is currently too much fragmentation & not enough accountability within the fed govt to effectively establish a strong biosecurity system to protect the US from all biological threats. https://t.co/Kic1dJyksE

In order to protect Americans from biological threats in all forms – man-made, accidental, or naturally occurring pathogens -we must ensure that our current legacy biodetection capabilities are replaced with advanced tech built on a strong foundation or research & testing. https://t.co/95Z9J1iFaU

Earlier today, @SenatorShaheen & I led a number of our colleagues in introducing a bipartisan resolution in support of Ukraine amid increased Russian aggression.

Our message is simple: Republicans & Dems in Congress are united in support of Ukrainian independence & sovereignty.

Appreciated the opportunity to meet @EnesFreedom today and hear his story. 

He’s shown tremendous courage in standing up for the Uyghurs in Xinjiang and calling out the atrocities of the Chinese Communist Party. https://t.co/IJSE1Sx1Ai

Democrat’s reckless policies have helped plunge our nation into the worst inflation crisis we’ve seen in decades. 

It’s clear that the last thing we need right now is billions more in government stimulus spending.

We cannot, and should not, wait for Russia to invade Ukraine to sanction their recent aggressive actions. 

That is why I joined 33 of my colleagues in introducing legislation to impose sanctions on Russia and provide military aid to Ukraine

"Inflation hits new 40-year high in January” 

We are in the midst of the worst inflation crisis in a generation. From the gas pump to the grocery store, middle class families are feeling the pinch. 
https://t.co/dfSNoGGajw
Too soon, @SenatorTimScott. Too soon. https://t.co/H6vSAsL2wx

Proud my legislation with @SenSherrodBrown to name the Avondale Post Office after #Ohioans John Leahr & Herb Heilbrun, 2 WWII pilots & public servants, has passed the Senate. I hope @POTUS signs this important bill into law soon to honor these heroes. https://t.co/UNGzmcgZ2X

Let’s start by passing CARA 3.0 to bolster evidence-based programs & provide communities with the resources needed to combat this epidemic. This is the sweeping bipartisan legislation we need, now, to help turn the tide of this crisis & save lives.

Over the past year, we have seen a heartbreaking surge in drug abuse and overdose deaths - particularly among younger individuals and minorities. 

Congress needs to take immediate action to combat this worsening epidemic. https://t.co/r8WR8ICClC

It's time for us in the Congress and for this government to speak with one voice. To come together and pass legislation supporting Ukraine and holding Russia accountable for their unwarranted aggression. https://t.co/RfC5cC9emy

Moscow would have the world believe this massive, unwarranted Russian build up is about trying to shore up its border against threats from Ukraine and NATO. 

This is, of course, patently false. 

NATO’s & Ukraine's military posture has always been defensive. https://t.co/QOkHEpRPRE

Ukraine is where the cause of freedom is under siege today, in our generation.

Eight years ago, Ukrainians made a very deliberate choice. They stood up to a corrupt Russian-backed government, and turned to the west, to the European Union, to America. Now we must stand with them. https://t.co/u5QcOSsHVo

The producer price index—a key measure of inflation that deals w/ wholesale prices for goods & services—increased nearly 10% over the past yr.

Inflation continues to surge at record pace. The last thing we need at this juncture is for Dems to resurrect their tax & spending spree
I urge Russia to back away from this invasion and seek a diplomatic off ramp.

A military invasion by Russia cannot erase Ukraine’s history of resilience. The Ukrainian people have now lived in a democracy for 30 years, and have shown many times that they will not accept leaders who try to reverse progress toward freedom and independence.
The allegations in Special Counsel John Durham’s court filing regarding mining of White House data are deeply disturbing and merit a full investigation by the @TheJusticeDept.

The situation in Ukraine remains deeply concerning. As I have repeatedly said, it'd be a grave mistake for Pres. Putin to invade Ukraine. We are united w our European Allies in our support for Ukraine. If necessary the Ukrainian people are ready to fight to protect their homeland
https://t.co/nVHB3hJMnm

At a hearing last week, a witness confirmed that Russia is targeting critical infrastructure and governmental organizations in Ukraine through cyberattacks in an effort to compromise the systems. Congress must pass this legislation to enhance our own cyber defense.
This is especially timely now as our nation runs the risk of potential Russian cyberattacks in retaliation for US support of Ukraine.
This bipartisan legislation will enable a whole-of-government response, mitigation, and warning to critical infrastructure and others of ongoing and imminent attacks.

Last week, I introduced the landmark Strengthening American Cybersecurity Act to give the @ONCDpress, @CISAgov & others broad visibility into the cyberattacks taking place across our nation on a daily basis. https://t.co/3EpKu4rRiW
What an incredible season. Thank you @Bengals. You’ve made Ohio proud. #WhoDey

It’s #SuperBowlSunDey and I’m joining fellow fans in downtown Cinti for a Game Dey Party. Looking forward to the Cincinnati @Bengals bringing home their first ever @SuperBowl victory. Best of luck to @JoeyB @Real10jayy__ and the entire team!  #WhoDey https://t.co/B2CLGkXoxk

From hospitals to food banks and everything in between, the @OHNationalGuard has played an indispensable role on the frontlines of this pandemic since day one. We are immensely grateful for their service. https://t.co/vOE9MBcbYF
Jane and I send our prayers to Alice and the entire Batchelder family.  https://t.co/CE5MDnXSSz

Bill Batchelder was a legendary Ohio legislator, and I was honored to call him a friend. I will miss his sound political advice, his sense of humor and the model of public service he demonstrated for nearly four decades representing his beloved Medina County.

.@WSJ: “Higher Inflation Is Probably Costing You $276 a Month." 

Inflation is a cruel, crippling tax on middle class families and those on fixed incomes. https://t.co/jIT2Z4GXej

With tensions escalating in Eastern Europe, it is imperative that the administration immediately approve the sale of M1A2 Abrams tanks to Poland. We need to provide our allies with the technologies and weaponry they need to defend themselves.https://t.co/aWaJQPQign
Passing the Pray Safe Act will ensure that all houses of worship who face threats of violence and terror have information on security trainings and NSGP applications.

The Pray Safe Act will improve nationwide knowledge of the Nonprofit Security Grant Program, which I have led efforts to increase the funding for, & can in turn improve the current unequal distribution of these grant funds across different states. https://t.co/viGguaKSBj

Last Sunday, @FOXNews published a joint op-ed highlighting how Congress should act quickly to pass our bipartisan Pray Safe Act to establish a centralized clearinghouse of security best practices, training resources, grant application info & more.

After more than 3 decades, the Cincinnati @Bengals are back in the Super Bowl! 

Looking forward to joining the festivities for the game tomorrow in my hometown of Cincinnati… Let’s bring it home! #WhoDey #RuleItAll

The Pray Safe Act will create a place for religious institutions to access information on trainings – like the trainings received by the Congregation Beth Israel synagogue that Rabbi Cytron-Walker lauded for providing lifesaving knowledge during last month’s hostage situation.

In a recent op-ed for @Foxnews, I discuss my efforts in the Senate to help strengthen the security of our religious communities, including my bipartisan Pray Safe Act which Congress should work quickly to pass. https://t.co/viGguaKSBj

Appreciate the Treasury Department affirming that crypto miners, stakers and those who sell hardware and software for wallets are not subject to tax reporting obligations. 

As I have said from the start, this requirement only applies to brokers. https://t.co/k5l6kDs4iA

This inflation crisis is a cruel tax that is devastating hard working families & undercutting small businesses. Dems should stop pursuing their reckless tax & spending spree and work with Republicans on common-sense economic policies that grow jobs & our economy.
Who is bearing the brunt of this inflation crisis? According to a new study from Wells Fargo, middle class families, Hispanics, and working parents are being hit the hardest. https://t.co/l6955jhLo6

The White House has been quick to tout rising wages. That is a positive thing but the reality is that rising inflation has actually wiped out these wage gains. In fact, when accounting for rising prices, workers made 1.7% less in the last year due to surging inflation.

What does this mean on the whole? U.S. households are spending an additional $250+ a month on goods and services. That is the true cost of inflation and it is crushing middle class families and folks living paycheck to paycheck. https://t.co/jIT2Z4GXej

What was most concerning about this inflation report was the breadth of the price increases. It is not just ‘used cars,’ rather we are seeing the cost of essentials - like gas & groceries - skyrocket. In fact, food costs are up 7.4% and gas prices have soared 40% over the past yr

Yesterday morning we learned that we are in the midst of the worst inflation crisis in 40 years. To understand why this situation is so devastating it is critical to dig a little deeper into the data:

Glad that the sailors on the #USSCincinnati will be able to watch the @Bengals win the #SuperBowl this Sunday!  #WhoDey
https://t.co/wRbkM0yL6P
This is Awesome! My personal favorite has to be Mana-Tee Higgins. https://t.co/gmPUbBZCpI

With tensions escalating in Eastern Europe, it is imperative we provide allies such as Poland - with the technologies and weaponry they need to defend themselves. It’s critical the admin approve the sale of M1A2 Abrams tanks to Poland without further delay.https://t.co/aWaJQPQign

With record-level applications for @FEMA mitigation programs, the $1.5B in the bipartisan Infrastructure Investment and Jobs Act for these important resiliency programs will have a real impact in communities across #Ohio & the US. https://t.co/1KNQrsLOyG
A cruel reality of the inflation crisis: prices are rising at a much faster pace than wages. As a result, folks are experiencing a painful decline in their purchasing power. https://t.co/XJWgfiSqZX

What is particularly concerning about today’s news is that the price increases are evident across the board. The cost of gas, groceries, housing, furniture are all surging at a record pace. The Dems created this crisis & now middle class families are bearing the brunt of the pain

"US inflation jumped 7.5% in the past year, a 40-year high"

This is the inevitable result of Dems’ reckless spending policies that have flooded the economy with $2 trillion in stimulus and demand-side spending. https://t.co/FB7y4ZHJQ6

That is why, unless Acting Director Young is able to produce the requested documents by the time her nomination comes to the Senate floor for a vote, I will not be in a position to support her nomination.

As a former OMB Director, I appreciate Ms. Young's willingness to work w/ members on both sides of the aisle. However, for nearly a year HSGAC has requested these documents to no avail. It reflects this admin’s lack of transparency & response to legitimate congressional requests.

For example, in our bipartisan COVID response investigation, we’ve received approx. 15,000 pages of emails/docs from the Trump White House but not one email from Biden White House. This is unacceptable. American taxpayers deserve transparency from the federal government.

I’m frustrated that after repeated bipartisan attempts to obtain documents in #HSGAC from @OMBpress & after repeated assurances from Act. Director Young that we would receive them, HSGAC has still not been sent requested documents to aid in our oversight responsibilities.
The fight for freedom is being waged in Ukraine right now, and the outcome is going to have profound effects, not just in Eastern Europe, but around the globe. https://t.co/APxW2hvYhp

Russia may exploit our cybersecurity vulnerabilities to attack the US in retaliation for supporting #Ukraine. That’s why we need legislation in place, like my bipartisan Strengthening American Cybersecurity Act to improve our cyber defenses.https://t.co/jT5qu4CVhH

I was concerned when an expert witness confirmed that Russia is targeting critical infrastructure & governmental organizations in #Ukraine through cyberattacks in an effort to compromise the systems for the likely purpose of espionage.

This vulnerability is one of many that demonstrates the need for Congress to pass my bipartisan Strengthening American Cybersecurity Act to significantly enhance our nation’s ability to combat ongoing cybersecurity threats against our critical infrastructure & federal government.

Yesterday at a #HSGAC hearing, I discussed the response to & lessons learned from the threat posed by the vulnerability in log4j software – which experts have said is one of the most serious and widespread cybersecurity risks ever seen. https://t.co/gXtSdYsGhC
The Border Patrol needs our help. That’s why I will introduce legislation soon to create a BP Reserve, increase the number of agents, and raise their pay. https://t.co/PE2CMavWkC

I’ve spoken to Border Patrol agents on my trips to the southern border who explain they are overwhelmed by the record level of unlawful migrants & deadly narcotics. These agents are rightly disappointed & demoralized by this admin’s failures to secure our border.

My hope is that Congress can come together and speak with one voice - Republicans and Democrats alike - to pass bipartisan sanctions legislation and an aid package that sends a strong message of support to the Ukrainian people. https://t.co/4PPXBkWF7P

California Senator @SenAlexPadilla and I decided to make a little wager ahead of the Super Bowl this Sunday. 

Can't wait to celebrate a @Bengals championship with a Langer's Deli pastrami sandwich and a few @goldenroadbrew beers! #RuleItAll https://t.co/v4I4qVeEeG

I believe naming this post office in their neighborhood for John & Herb is a fitting way to honor the memory of this team who served our country with bravery & distinction in WWII & continued an important part of their public service long after their military service ended.

Last night on the @Senatefloor, I spoke in support of my bipartisan bill sponsored by the entire Ohio delegation to name the post office in Avondale of Cincinnati, #Ohio for two WWII aviators, John Leahr & Herbert Heilbrun. https://t.co/NuNGyhnmLd

The four time deported unlawful migrant with a lengthy criminal history of arrests -including assault and drugs- will not be deported following his most recent offense of defacing Union Station with swastikas according to @ICE. This is unacceptable.  https://t.co/XsnfkuHruC

Honored to deliver the keynote address at the @INCOMPAS summit this morning. Great discussion focusing on the transformative impact the broadband investments of the bipartisan infrastructure bill will have throughout America. https://t.co/t49sk28Kkl

In addition, since 2019, I’ve authored 2 bipartisan investigative reports highlighting the failings of fed. agencies to protect their networks. I’m glad this legislation will address recommendations in those reports to significantly update FISMA & provide necessary accountability

As cyber & ransomware attacks continue to increase, the federal govt must quickly coordinate its response and hold bad actors accountable. This bill strikes a balance between getting info quickly & letting victims respond to an attack without imposing burdensome requirements.

I’ve introduced bipartisan legislation w @SenGaryPeters to give @ONCDPress, @CISAgov & other agencies broad visibility into the cyberattacks taking place in the US to enable a whole-of-govt response, mitigation & warning of ongoing & imminent attacks. https://t.co/3EpKu4sp8u

Mexican transnational criminal organizations are increasingly working with criminal gangs in China to import the ingredients used to make fentanyl into Mexico.

The Biden administration must pressure China to do more to address this issue. https://t.co/DBa0rFpnEJ

In a recent @FOXNews op-ed I wrote with @SenatorHassan, we urge Congress to pass our bipartisan Pray Safe Act to ensure houses of worship who face threats of violence & terror have the info & resources they need to protect their congregations. https://t.co/viGguaLqqR

Glad the IRS is abandoning their plan to use facial recognition for identity verification. This is a big win for privacy and common-sense, and something I fought for: https://t.co/jvxemtNdLk  https://t.co/EQpLtJ3VIx

The cause of freedom in Eastern Europe and the stability of the continent is at stake in the Ukraine-Russia conflict. 

It is imperative that we continue to do all we can to support the Ukrainian people and their right to determine their own future. https://t.co/bAD0Wto94g

Please to see the well-deserved honor of Col. Charles Young posthumously promoted to the rank of General for his service in the @USArmy. 

Grateful my Restore Our Parks Act will help preserve Young’s legacy at his namesake national park: @CharlesYoungNPS
https://t.co/RyzPiHI3ev

ICYMI: In a joint op-ed w @SenatorHassan for @FOXNews, we discuss the need for Congress to pass our bipartisan Pray Safe Act to ensure all of our religious communities have the resources they need to secure protection to be able to pray & gather in peace.https://t.co/viGguaKSBj

In my trips to the southern border, I’ve spoken with @CBP officials & they have all expressed the need for more agents and advanced technology to help them do their job & protect our country. I’m working on a bill that will help these agents & give them the resources they need

The ongoing unlawful migrants & drugs crisis at our southern border is clear & persistent. The Biden admin must change course and deter the human smugglers & drug traffickers from unlawfully entering our country. American lives depend on it. https://t.co/1WtzPVpTHn
Jane and I had a great day joining OSU President Johnson and her wife Veronica for a Buckeye basketball game. Go Bucks!! https://t.co/iy4jw5H2d6

Jane and I are proud to be honored with the Boy Scouts Eagle Scout Court of Honor award this weekend. My family has a long history with the @boyscouts and I am grateful for all they do to train the next generation of leaders in our country. https://t.co/OufkDfrjwZ
Enjoyed speaking with the @thedispatch this week about the situation in Ukraine and what should be done to try to deter Russia from invading their sovereign territory again. https://t.co/LXAPc0nDJV

This week, the Senate unanimously approved a resolution condemning the brutal Lukashenko regime & affirming America’s support for the people of Belarus. They deserve free and fair elections and a democracy where their sovereign rights are respected.  https://t.co/cosGLvEYV6

No company should ever profit from the exploitation of a child, nor avoid legal responsibility in a court of law. 

That is why I'm co-sponsoring a bill to remove tech companies’ blanket immunity from Federal and State child sexual abuse material laws.https://t.co/hthCeIq8Jv

Important reporting by @JakeTapper & @David_Culver shedding light on China’s human rights abuses. 

As we cheer on our athletes competing in the Olympic games, it’s critical we don’t lose sight of the atrocities being committed by the Chinese Communist Party. https://t.co/tKCsx23ztJ

With more natural disasters there have been a record level applications for FEMA mitigation programs. The new support in the bipartisan Infrastructure bill for these important resiliency programs are needed and will have a positive impact on communities across the country.

Great to see Joe Burrow’s parents on Fox yesterday talking about @JoeyB’s journey from Athens High School in The Plains, Ohio, to starting QB in the Super Bowl. 

We’re very proud of you, Joe! Can’t wait to watch you on the field in LA next Sunday. https://t.co/oLhRmlsPgy

Deeply disappointed with the Biden admin's decision undermining domestic production of solar panels. 

This will only serve to further empower China to the detriment of American workers and manufacturers. #Jobs

This policy is a national security threat and should be revoked as quickly as possible. The Biden administration is giving the green light to human smugglers and drug traffickers to unlawfully enter our country with no consequence. https://t.co/Oll5dcAX3E

Today I introduced a bill to prohibit @TSA from accepting arrest warrants of unlawful migrants as proof of ID. I'm concerned that @DHSgov is allowing individuals to fly based on unverified personal data given when they crossed the border unlawfully.

I urge the administration to 
ensure U.S. companies aren’t disadvantaged for using tax credits created by Congress and work with congressional Republicans to enact pro-growth policies that will reduce the tax and regulatory burden on America’s job creators.

The Biden Admin proposal to allow other countries to hike taxes on American companies is a job killer and creates further uncertainty for American workers at a time when they can least afford it given current economic pressures. 
https://t.co/jy5MddIlZk

We owe it to our future generations to preserve our planet’s rich wildlife & natural resources so they can continue to be enjoyed & I’m hopeful my Senate colleagues will join me in ensuring that every last stamp is sold.

I applaud the passage of my bipartisan legislation with @SenatorCarper in #HSGAC which requires @USPS to sell the approximately 41M remaining Saving Vanishing Species Stamps left in stock. https://t.co/z7KU3n8Ztd

This criminal should not have been able to hatefully deface Union Station with antisemitic symbols. He is a convicted felon & an unlawful migrant with a criminal history of deportations & arrests. 

It is inexcusable that @ICE did not take custody of him. https://t.co/CoDuTHkGGq

I commend the brave Special Forces operators who carried out the mission against Abu Ibrahim al-Hashimi al-Qurayshi last night. 

Al-Qurayshi was a ruthless terrorist responsible for the deaths of countless civilians. The world is a safer place today. https://t.co/1C7rzbNbor

Instead, I called on this admin to provide Congress with a plan to deter illegal immigration, to detect & deny deadly drugs from crossing our border that are causing a record # of overdose deaths.
 
America’s national security depends on it. 
 
American lives depend on it.

Today on the Senate floor, I once again urged the Biden admin to stop the policies that give the green light to human smugglers to be able to exploit migrants & families and to stop giving a green light to the drug traffickers that are poisoning our communities. https://t.co/ITiN4zp3GP

Yesterday I joined Sen. @ChrisVanHollen, @SenHydeSmith & @SenGaryPeters in sending a letter to @OIGUSPS requesting an investigation into the delays with the USPS Free Matter for the Blind or Other Physically Handicapped Persons program. https://t.co/o63Zvbh8Ym

By naming the post office, we will honor the memory and lives of two incredible men who served our country during World War II and continued their public service long after their military service came to an end.

I’m proud that bipartisan legislation I introduced with @SenSherrodBrown to name the Avondale Post Office in Cincinnati after John Leahr and Herb Heilbrun advanced out of Senate HSGAC earlier today. https://t.co/ujfmRAKLI1

Profoundly moving images out of New York today as thousands lined the street to pay their respects to fallen NYPD Officer Wilbert Mora. 

My prayers are with Ofc. Mora’s and Det. Jason Rivera’s family, friends, and brothers in blue. 

Images via @GettyImages https://t.co/YgrhiH8b8R

Recently, my bipartisan DHS Blue Campaign Enhancement Act was signed into law to help raise public awareness about the indicators of human trafficking & ensure law enforcement can respond quickly & effectively while holding traffickers accountable for their actions.
Today I spoke on a HSGAC Blue Campaign virtual panel about how Congress can support @DHSgov’s work to prevent and respond to human trafficking. https://t.co/YI6v39Ging
My hope is that Congress can come together to pass legislation and issue a strong message to the people of Ukraine that we stand with them in their fight for freedom. https://t.co/QTYXVpZfBe

Despite Russia's unrelenting efforts to destabilize Ukraine over the past 8 years, the people of Ukraine have remained committed to securing their own independent, sovereign and Democratic future. 

It is imperative that we stand with them. https://t.co/o7lScXe7aZ

Russia’s attempts to destabilize Ukraine’s vibrant democracy has global repercussions. This is where the fight for freedom & self-determination are being held, and the outcome will affect not just Ukraine & Eastern Europe, but countries all over the world.
https://t.co/RBes1EV5rN
Wishing @SenatorLujan a full and speedy recovery. Look forward to seeing Ben back in Washington D.C. soon! https://t.co/ev4mWEjrV8

February is Black History Month - a time for us to commemorate the immeasurable contributions Black Americans have made - and continue to make - to our country. #BlackHistoryMonth https://t.co/Tfb70FZ1cq

It’s imperative that the House and Senate come together quickly to pass a bipartisan sanctions & aid package. 

With the threat from Russia growing by the day, the US must do all it can to help our ally Ukraine. https://t.co/cu6XWGX2Kq

The @amnesty report labeling #Israel an apartheid state should be condemned by all. 

This report is inflammatory and undermines efforts to achieve lasting peace and coexistence between Israelis and Palestinians. https://t.co/U8JGTeBNPj

Gas prices soaring in Ohio & across the nation. This worsening energy and inflation crisis is putting a real pinch on American families. It’s past time the Biden Admin support our domestic energy producers to lower costs & support America's energy security.https://t.co/BSGtd0aQ8p

Pleased to announce that Ohio counties can now apply for increased infrastructure funding through federal RAISE grants. 

This is a direct result of the bipartisan Infrastructure bill - which is creating opportunities for more local infrastructure projects than ever before.

Germany needs to step up and do more to support Ukraine. I urge their leaders to publicly make it clear that they will cut off the Nord Stream 2 pipeline if Russia invades Ukraine. https://t.co/UuDwfew99t

At its core, the Ukraine-Russia conflict is a fight for freedom. Ukraine wants to be a democracy with the rule of law and a free-enterprise system. That is why President Putin feels so threatened. https://t.co/4zyznwPwEj
I call on the Biden admin to implement a plan to curb the influx of unlawful migrants & illicit narcotics so our communities in #Ohio and across the country can be safe and secure.

This is concerning given that fentanyl is flooding across our southern border in record amounts. Last year CBP seized nearly 10K lbs, a 40% increase from 2020. According to @CDCgov, fentanyl & other synthetic opioids caused 64% of the more than 100K drug overdose deaths last yr.

CBP reported more than 178,840 total encounters at the border in December, the highest December on record. Normally, unlawful migration would be decreasing over the colder winter months, instead we continue to see surging, record-breaking levels of encounters at the border.

Earlier this week, @CBP released Dec operational statistics which show that the unlawful migration crisis continues to grow. This is a product of the Biden admin’s decision to dismantle the previous admin’s policies with no consideration of the historic influx it would incite.

In the coming days, I’m optimistic the Senate will come together around a strong, bipartisan package that will sanction Russia for their aggressive posture and provide Ukraine with additional military aid. https://t.co/LCtQw3lj1x
What an incredible game! We will see you in the Super Bowl!  #WhoDey https://t.co/c2lWOdgxmt

Who Dey! It's gameday Ohio! 

Can't wait to watch my @Bengals take on the Chiefs at 3pm this afternoon. https://t.co/tyt5XqsKuZ

Spoke with @ChuckTodd on @MeetthePress this morning about the escalating crisis in Ukraine. 

It is imperative that our allies remains united with us in support of the Ukrainian people as they face continued Russian aggression. https://t.co/8PFkYE9hVJ

Had a great time at the @OhioFarmBureau breakfast earlier this morning. Great discussion focusing on what’s going on in D.C. and how the bipartisan infrastructure bill will positively impact Ohio farmers. https://t.co/v1435AtZmP

We are seeing the highest inflation levels in a generation. Middle class families and folks on fixed incomes are bearing the brunt of the pain.

…and the huge volume of imports of bifacial modules that entered free of tariffs between June 2019 and October 2020, the record indicates that the bifacial exclusion was an impediment to the domestic industry’s positive adjustment to import competition during the remedy period.”

From the ITC report: “Given the substitutability between monofacial and bifacial modules, the small but increasing domestic production of bifacial modules at the time the bifacial exclusion went into effect…

Bifacial solar panels already not covered by the tariffs so we know the impact surges of these solar panels on U.S. manufacturing. Don’t take my word for it—the bipartisan, independent International Trade Commission already warned the administration about the cost to U.S. #jobs.
